Sincerely,

Parents,
Chickamauga City Schools will be following a half day schedule Monday, August 21, in an effort to ensure the safety and well-being of students. While we have enjoyed activities and studying about the eclipse, we will dismiss students early so they can safely travel home before the eclipse begins. The peak of the eclipse, when we will have 98% darkness, is during the regular dismissal time. We want to avoid exposing students to driving at that time. We have provided safety information about watching the eclipse, and stressed that looking at the eclipse without protective eye gear can cause permanent damage to the eyes. Additionally, regular sunglasses will not protect your eyes from the danger of the eclipse. This is a once in a lifetime event, but we strongly advise watching it on television rather than taking a chance on damaging your vision for a lifetime.

Chickamauga City Schools has been identified by the Georgia Department of Education (GaDOE) as a Title I Distinguished District for the 2016-2017 school year. Recognition is based on the combined academic achievement gains of the economically disadvantaged subgroup for assessments administered in the FY13, FY14, & FY15 school terms. One award is given for each of the following categories: large, medium, small and extra-small school districts. Chickamauga City is recognized in the category of extra-small school district. Previously, Chickamauga City received this recognition for the 2011-12, 2013-14 and 2014-15 school years.
